CatDescriptText: John Sham, recently discharged vet, North Side and W.A. McCullough, laborer, Crafton were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 5, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think voters will choose the Republican or the Democratic candidate for the presidency?"  Mr. Sham's answer reads: "A Democrat, because the Republicans have been in office so long."  Mr. McCullough's answer reads: "The Republicans have been doing pretty good on the job.  Let's hope that they are re-elected."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of John Sham wearing dark cross hatch patterned overcoat with upturned collar, standing in front of store; Portrait of W.A. McCullough wearing dark cap, eyeglasses, and jacket with dark buttons, standing on Liberty Avenue, Downtown
